item.name: Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions Committee
Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions Committee

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

summary.text:
Protecting Collective Bargaining Agreements Under One-Touch Make-Ready Act

This bill makes inapplicable any provision of the Federal Communications Commission rules relating to telecommunications attachments to utility poles that conflicts with certain labor laws or an existing collective bargaining agreement.

bill.title: Protecting Collective Bargaining Agreements Under One-Touch Make-Ready Act

item.title: Protecting Collective Bargaining Agreements Under One-Touch Make-Ready Act
Protecting Collective Bargaining Agreements Under One-Touch Make-Ready Act

A bill to clarify that the "one-touch make-ready" rules of the Federal Communication Commission for utility pole attachments do not supersede the National Labor Relations Act or collective bargaining agreements.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
